intro: Rhodanthemum briquetii, commonly known as the Briquet's rhodanthemum, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, composite flower heads. The plant typically produces bright yellow to orange ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
